It provides a way to embed the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/casper-ecosystem/casper-client-rs\"\u003ecasper-client-rs\u003c/a\u003e into another application without the CLI interface. The SDK exposes a list of types and methods from a subset of the Casper client.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can use the Casper Rust/Wasm SDK in two ways:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul By creating a deploy watcher, developers can subscribe to specific deploy hashes and define custom callback functions to handle these events. The watcher is then started, and as deploy events occur, the specified callback functions are executed. This mechanism enables real-time responsiveness to deploy events within Rust applications.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-rust notranslate position-relative timeout_duration = None; // Some(30000) for 30s instead of default timeout duration of 60s\n\n// Creates a watcher instance\nlet mut watcher = sdk.watch_deploy(DEFAULT_EVENT_ADDRESS, timeout_duration);\n\n// Create a callback function handler of your design\nlet event_handler_fn = get_event_handler_fn(deploy_hash.to_string());\n\nlet mut deploy_subscriptions: Vec\u0026lt;DeploySubscription\u0026gt; = vec![];\ndeploy_subscriptions.push(DeploySubscription::new(\n    deploy_hash.to_string(),\n    EventHandlerFn::new(event_handler_fn),\n));\n\n// Subscribe and <p dir="auto">The Rust/Wasm SDK allows developers and users to interact with the Casper Blockchain using Rust or TypeScript. It provides a way to embed the <a href="https://github.com/casper-ecosystem/casper-client-rs">casper-client-rs</a> into another application without the CLI interface. The SDK exposes a list of types and methods from a subset of the Casper client.</p>
<p dir="auto">You can use the Casper Rust/Wasm SDK in two ways:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>In a <strong>Rust application</strong> by importing the SDK crate.</li>
<li>In a <strong>Typescript application</strong> by importing the SDK Wasm file and the Typescript interfaces.</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">This page covers different examples of using the SDK.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Install</h2><a id="user-content-install" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Install" href="#install"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<details>
  <summary><strong><code>Rust Project</code></strong></summary>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Rust Project</h2><a id="user-content-rust-project" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Rust Project" href="#rust-project"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Add the SDK as a dependency of your project:</p>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto">Cargo.toml</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-toml notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="casper-rust-wasm-sdk = { version = &quot;0.1.0&quot;, git = &quot;https://github.com/casper-ecosystem/rustSDK.git&quot; }"><pre><span class="pl-smi">casper-rust-wasm-sdk</span> = { <span class="pl-smi">version</span> = <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>0.1.0<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">git</span> = <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>https://github.com/casper-ecosystem/rustSDK.git<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> }</pre></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Usage</h2><a id="user-content-usage" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Usage" href="#usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto">main.rs</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-rust notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="use casper_rust_wasm_sdk::{types::verbosity::Verbosity, SDK};

let sdk = SDK::new(
  Some(&quot;https://rpc.testnet.casperlabs.io&quot;.to_string()),
  Some(Verbosity::High)
);"><pre><span class="pl-k">use</span> casper_rust_wasm_sdk<span class="pl-kos">::</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>types<span class="pl-kos">::</span>verbosity<span class="pl-kos">::</span><span class="pl-v">Verbosity</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-v">SDK</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>

<span class="pl-k">let</span> sdk = <span class="pl-smi">SDK</span><span class="pl-kos">::</span><span class="pl-en">new</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span>
  <span class="pl-v">Some</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">"https://rpc.testnet.casperlabs.io"</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">to_string</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
  <span class="pl-v">Some</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-smi">Verbosity</span><span class="pl-kos">::</span><span class="pl-v">High</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Typescript Project</h2><a id="user-content-typescript-project" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Typescript Project" href="#typescript-project"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">You can directly use the content of the <a href="/casper-ecosystem/rustSDK/blob/dev-1.6/docs/pkg">pkg folder</a> for a browser project or <a href="/casper-ecosystem/rustSDK/blob/dev-1.6/docs/pkg-nodejs">pkg-nodejs</a> for a Node project.</p>
<p dir="auto">Or you can use the [TODO]<a href="https://todo" rel="nofollow">npm package</a></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Build package with Wasm pack</h4><a id="user-content-build-package-with-wasm-pack" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Build package with Wasm pack" href="#build-package-with-wasm-pack"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">If you want to compile the Wasm package from Rust you may need to install <code>wasm-pack</code> for ease of use.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="curl https://rustwasm.github.io/wasm-pack/installer/init.sh -sSf | sh"><pre>curl https://rustwasm.github.io/wasm-pack/installer/init.sh -sSf <span class="pl-k">|</span> sh</pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ make prepare
$ make pack"><pre>$ make prepare
$ make pack</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">This will create a <code>pkg</code> and <code>pkg-nodejs</code> containing the Typescript interfaces. You can find more details about building the SDK for Javascript with <code>wasm-pack</code> in the <a href="https://rustwasm.github.io/docs/wasm-pack/commands/build.html" rel="nofollow">wasm-pack documention</a>.</p>
<p dir="auto">This folder contains a Wasm binary, a JS wrapper file, Typescript types definitions, and a package.json file that you can load in your project.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ tree pkg

├── LICENSE

└── README.md"><pre>$ tree pkg

<p dir="auto">The React app needs to load the Wasm file through a dedicated <code>init()</code> method as per this example:</p>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto">App.tsx</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import init, {
  SDK,
  Verbosity,
} from 'casper-sdk';

const node_address = 'https://rpc.testnet.casperlabs.io';
const verbosity = Verbosity.High;

function App() {
  const [wasm, setWasm] = useState(false);
  const fetchWasm = async () =&gt; {
    await init();
    setWasm(true);
  };

  useEffect(() =&gt; {
    initApp(); // take care here to initiate app only once and not on every effect
  }, []);

  const initApp = async () =&gt; {
  if (!wasm) {
    await fetchWasm();
  };

  const sdk = new SDK(node_address, verbosity);
  console.log(sdk);

<p dir="auto">The Angular app needs to load the Wasm file through a dedicated <code>init()</code> method as per this example. You can import it into a component through a service but it is advised to import it through a factory with the injection token <a href="https://angular.io/api/core/APP_INITIALIZER" rel="nofollow">APP_INITIALIZER</a>.</p>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto">wasm.factory.ts</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import init, { SDK, Verbosity } from 'casper-sdk';

export const SDK_TOKEN = new InjectionToken() &lt; SDK &gt; 'SDK';
export const WASM_ASSET_PATH =
  new InjectionToken() &lt; string &gt; 'wasm_asset_path';
export const NODE_ADDRESS = new InjectionToken() &lt; string &gt; 'node_address';
export const VERBOSITY = new InjectionToken() &lt; Verbosity &gt; 'verbosity';

type Params = {
  wasm_asset_path: string,
  node_address: string,
  verbosity: Verbosity,
};

export const fetchWasmFactory = async (params: Params): Promise&lt;SDK&gt; =&gt; {
  const wasm = await init(params.wasm_asset_path);
  return new SDK(params.node_address, params.verbosity);
};"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">init</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">SDK</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-v">Verbosity</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'casper-sdk'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>

<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">WASM_ASSET_PATH</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span>
  <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">InjectionToken</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">&lt;</span> <span class="pl-s1">string</span> <span class="pl-c1">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-s">'wasm_asset_path'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>
<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">NODE_ADDRESS</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">InjectionToken</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">&lt;</span> <span class="pl-s1">string</span> <span class="pl-c1">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-s">'node_address'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>
<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">VERBOSITY</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">InjectionToken</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">&lt;</span> <span class="pl-v">Verbosity</span> <span class="pl-c1">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-s">'verbosity'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>

<span class="pl-s1">type</span> <span class="pl-v">Params</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>

  <span class="pl-c1">verbosity</span>: <span class="pl-v">Verbosity</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>

<span class="pl-k">export</span> <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">fetchWasmFactory</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">async</span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">params</span>: <span class="pl-v">Params</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>: <span class="pl-v">Promise</span><span class="pl-c1">&lt;</span><span class="pl-c1">SDK</span><span class="pl-c1">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">=&gt;</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>

<p dir="auto">You can look at a basic example of factory usage in the <a href="/casper-ecosystem/rustSDK/blob/dev-1.6/docs/examples/frontend/angular/libs/util/services/wasm/src/lib/wasm.factory.ts">Angular example app</a>.</p>
<p dir="auto">Add the SDK Wasm file to the assets of your project with the path parameter being <code> wasm_asset_path:'assets/casper_rust_wasm_sdk_bg.wasm'</code>, Angular will then copy the file from <code>pkg</code> in <code>assets</code> on build making it available for the fetch Wasm factory.</p>

<p dir="auto">The Node app loads the SDK with <code>require()</code>. You can find more details about building the SDK for <a href="https://rustwasm.github.io/docs/wasm-bindgen/reference/deployment.html#nodejs" rel="nofollow">Node with wasm-pack</a>.
Note that this method requires a version of Node.js with WebAssembly support, which is currently Node 8 and above.</p>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto">index.ts</p>
</blockquote>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// with require
const casper_sdk = require('casper-sdk');
const { SDK } = casper_sdk;

// or with import
import { SDK } from 'casper-sdk';

const node_address = 'https://rpc.integration.casperlabs.io';

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Get deploy by deploy hash</h4><a id="user-content-get-deploy-by-deploy-hash-1" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Get deploy by deploy hash" href="#get-deploy-by-deploy-hash-1"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import { Deploy } from 'casper-sdk';

const deploy_hash_as_string =
  'a8778b2e4bd1ad02c168329a1f6f3674513f4d350da1b5f078e058a3422ad0b9';
const finalized_approvals = true;

const get_deploy_options = sdk.get_deploy_options({
  deploy_hash_as_string,
  finalized_approvals,
});

const deploy_result = await sdk.get_deploy(get_deploy_options);

const deploy: Deploy = deploy_result.deploy;

};

-----END PRIVATE KEY-----&quot;#;
pub const PAYMENT_AMOUNT: &amp;str = &quot;100000000&quot;;
pub const TRANSFER_AMOUNT: &amp;str = &quot;2500000000&quot;;
pub const TARGET_ACCOUNT: &amp;str =
    &quot;018f2875776bc73e416daf1cf0df270efbb52becf1fc6af6d364d29d61ae23fe44&quot;;
pub const TTL: &amp;str = &quot;1h&quot;;

    CHAIN_NAME,
    PUBLIC_KEY, // sender account
    Some(PRIVATE_KEY.to_string()),
    None,                  // optional timestamp
    Some(TTL.to_string()), // optional TTL
);

let payment_params = PaymentStrParams::default();
payment_params.set_payment_amount(PAYMENT_AMOUNT);

<p dir="auto">The watch_deploy functionality facilitates actively monitoring deploy events. By creating a deploy watcher, developers can subscribe to specific deploy hashes and define custom callback functions to handle these events. The watcher is then started, and as deploy events occur, the specified callback functions are executed. This mechanism enables real-time responsiveness to deploy events within Rust applications.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-rust notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="use casper_rust_wasm_sdk::deploy_watcher::watcher::{
    DeploySubscription, EventHandlerFn,
};

pub const DEFAULT_EVENT_ADDRESS: &amp;str = &quot;http://127.0.0.1:18101/events/main&quot;;

let deploy_hash = &quot;c94ff7a9f86592681e69c1d8c2d7d2fed89fd1a922faa0ae74481f8458af2ee4&quot;;

let timeout_duration = None; // Some(30000) for 30s instead of default timeout duration of 60s

// Creates a watcher instance
let mut watcher = sdk.watch_deploy(DEFAULT_EVENT_ADDRESS, timeout_duration);

// Create a callback function handler of your design
let event_handler_fn = get_event_handler_fn(deploy_hash.to_string());

let mut deploy_subscriptions: Vec&lt;DeploySubscription&gt; = vec![];
deploy_subscriptions.push(DeploySubscription::new(
    deploy_hash.to_string(),
    EventHandlerFn::new(event_handler_fn),
));

// Subscribe and start watching
let _ = watcher.subscribe(deploy_subscriptions);
let results = watcher.start().await;
watcher.stop();

<p dir="auto">Similarly, TypeScript developers can utilize the watchDeploy function to actively watch for deploy events on the Casper blockchain. By creating a deploy watcher and defining callback functions, developers can subscribe to specific deploy hashes and respond dynamically as events unfold.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import { EventParseResult, DeploySubscription } from 'casper-sdk';

const events_address = 'http://127.0.0.1:18101/events/main';

const deploy_hash =
  'c94ff7a9f86592681e69c1d8c2d7d2fed89fd1a922faa0ae74481f8458af2ee4';

// Creates a watcher instance
const watcher = sdk.watchDeploy(events_address);

// Create a callback function handler of your design
const getEventHandlerFn = (deployHash: string) =&gt; {
  const eventHandlerFn = (eventParseResult: EventParseResult) =&gt; {
    console.log(`callback for ${deployHash}`);
    if (eventParseResult.err) {
      return false;
    } else if (
      eventParseResult.body?.DeployProcessed?.execution_result.Success
    ) {
      console.log(
        eventParseResult.body?.DeployProcessed?.execution_result.Success
      );
      return true;
    } else {
      console.error(
        eventParseResult.body?.DeployProcessed?.execution_result.Failure
      );
      return false;
    }
  };
  return eventHandlerFn;
};

const eventHandlerFn = getEventHandlerFn(deploy_hash);

const deploySubscription: DeploySubscription = new DeploySubscription(
  deploy_hash,
  eventHandlerFn
);
const deploySubscriptions: DeploySubscription[] = [deploySubscription];

// Subscribe and start watching
watcher.subscribe(deploySubscriptions);
const results = await watcher.start();
watcher.stop();
console.log(results);"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-smi">EventParseResult</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-smi">DeploySubscription</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'casper-sdk'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>

<span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">events_address</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">'http://127.0.0.1:18101/events/main'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>

pub const PRIVATE_KEY: &amp;str = r#&quot;-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
    -----END PRIVATE KEY-----&quot;#;
pub const CONTRACT_HASH: &amp;str =
    &quot;hash-c12808431d490e2c463c2f968d0a4eaa0f9d57842508d9041aa42e2bd21eb96c&quot;;
pub const ENTRYPOINT_MINT: &amp;str = &quot;mint&quot;;
pub const TOKEN_OWNER: &amp;str =
    &quot;account-hash-878985c8c07064e09e67cc349dd21219b8e41942a0adc4bfa378cf0eace32611&quot;;
pub const PAYMENT_AMOUNT: &amp;str = &quot;5000000000&quot;;

let deploy_params = DeployStrParams::new(
    CHAIN_NAME,
    PUBLIC_KEY,
    Some(PRIVATE_KEY.to_string()),
    None,
    None,
);
let mut session_params = SessionStrParams::default();
session_params.set_session_hash(CONTRACT_HASH);
session_params.set_session_entry_point(ENTRYPOINT_MINT);

let args = Vec::from([
    &quot;token_meta_data:String='test_meta_data'&quot;.to_string(),
    format!(&quot;token_owner:Key='{TOKEN_OWNER}'&quot;).to_string(),
]);
session_params.set_session_args(args);

let payment_params = PaymentStrParams::default();
payment_params.set_payment_amount(PAYMENT_AMOUNT);
let call_entrypoint = sdk
    .call_entrypoint(deploy_params, session_params, payment_params, None)

<p dir="auto">Tests are run against NCTL by default. Alternately, you may configure another network in corresponding configurations. Testes assume a <code>secret_key.pem</code> will be located in the root <code>tests</code> directory, or one level higher at <code>../NCTL/casper-node/utils/nctl/assets/net-1/users/user-1/</code>. This path can be changed in the configuration.
(Rust tests must be run with <code>--test-threads=1</code>)</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="/casper-ecosystem/rustSDK/blob/dev-1.6/docs/tests/integration/rust">Rust Integration tests</a> can be run with</li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="make integration-test"><pre>make integration-test</pre></div>

<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="/casper-ecosystem/rustSDK/blob/dev-1.6/docs/tests/e2e">Jest/Puppeteer E2E tests</a> can be run with</li>
</ul>

npm install"><pre><span class="pl-c1">cd</span> tests/e2e/puppeteer
npm install</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">then</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="make e2e-test"><pre>make e2e-test</pre></div>
